seo.title: Coaching services
seo.description: Explore SustainSage coaching pathways designed for relocation, early-career decisions, working parent rhythms, and cross-cultural leadership.

hero.title: Coaching pathways shaped with you
hero.subtitle: Each pathway is a starting point. We adapt pace, language, and focus once we understand your reality.

pathways.title: Choose a pathway
pathways.description: Four pathways clients ask for most often. Each one flexes to match your context.

cards.title: Transition coaching
cards.target: For relocations, returns, and role changes.
cards.scenario: You want a steady partner while reshaping work, place, and support systems in the UK.
topics: Map the realities of visas, finances, care, and capacity before leaping.
Design decisions that honour both new possibilities and current limits.
Experiment with CVs, conversations, or trial roles without burning out.

cards.title: Early-career coaching
cards.scenario: You want space to test options and name what matters without pretending you “have it together.”
topics: Translate family, financial, and personal expectations into doable steps.
Hold space for doubt while you build language for what you want.
Prototype side projects, conversations, or moves safely before deciding.

cards.title: Working parent coaching
cards.target: For parents and caregivers rebuilding rhythms.
cards.scenario: You need breathing room to juggle care, work, and identity without stretching beyond capacity.
topics: Surface invisible labour and design boundaries you can actually hold.
Negotiate support at work and home without guilt-driven decisions.
Create sustainable self-care that fits into the week, not the wishlist.

cards.title: Leadership coaching
cards.target: For managers in complex, cross-cultural roles.
cards.scenario: You want a reflective partner while you lead across borders, expectations, and power lines.
topics: Ground decisions in role clarity so you stop carrying what is not yours.
Design high-stakes conversations with cultural nuance and integrity.
Sustain your leadership without overwork as proof of value.

cta.title: Not sure where to start?
cta.body: A 20-minute intro chat lets us hear your context and shape the right mix together.

seo.title: Transition coaching for relocations and role shifts | SustainSage
seo.description: Navigate relocation, role or sector change with grounded, ICF-aligned coaching that keeps your agency central.

hero.title: Support for relocation, role or sector change without losing yourself.
hero.subtitle: We build calm structure around your move so you can honour commitments in the UK and at home.

who.title: Who this is for
who.description: Real-world contexts clients bring into this space.

items.summary: Newly arrived in the UK while keeping ties elsewhere.
items.detail: You are registering with the GP, setting up HMRC accounts, and still carrying commitments in Taipei, Hong Kong, or Singapore.

items.summary: Switching sector or function as you relocate.
items.detail: You are moving from corporate to charity, or from specialist to manager, and want support translating your track record.

items.summary: Coordinating a move with partner or family.
items.detail: Two time zones, school calendars, or visa stages mean decisions need to be collaborative, not rushed.
You paused for caregiving, study, or health and want to re-enter without repeating burnout patterns.

topics.title: Common topics we work on
topics.description: Specific, practical tensions we often unpack together.

items.summary: Recruiters say your CV sounds “too local” or “too senior” for UK roles.
items.detail: We translate accomplishments into UK language without erasing context.

items.summary: Interviews stall before the final round.
items.detail: We rehearse stories that connect your past impact with the realities of UK teams.

items.summary: You are renegotiating finances, savings, and risk as you relocate.
items.detail: We map living costs, exchange rates, and shared budgets alongside your career aims.

items.summary: Family expects frequent travel back or quick decisions.
items.detail: We design conversations that honour relationships while holding your boundaries.

items.summary: A voice keeps saying it is “too late” to start over.
items.detail: We challenge the story, gather data, and plan experiments before you commit.

howWeWork.title: How we work together
howWeWork.description: Core package: six 55-minute sessions over eight to ten weeks, fully online via Zoom.

items.detail: Map your transition, check chemistry, and decide whether to continue.
Visas, finances, emotional load, dependants—we chart what is fixed and what is flexible.
Draft UK-focused CVs, rehearse conversations, or test trial weeks before committing.
Review what the experiments showed, set boundaries, and plan the next quarter.

howWeWork.note: Between sessions you can request light check-ins via email or voice notes if helpful.

expect.title: What may shift for you
expect.description: No guaranteed outcomes—clients often describe these shifts.

items.summary: Clearer story for employers and networks.
items.detail: Language that honours your past while showing UK relevance.
Two or three scenarios with next steps instead of endless hypotheticals.
A week-by-week rhythm balancing admin, care, and exploration.

items.summary: Signals to bring in other professionals.
items.detail: Knowing when to involve lawyers, therapists, or financial planners.

boundaries.title: Boundaries & ethics
boundaries.description: ICF-aligned practice keeps your autonomy central.

items.summary: No legal, immigration, or tax advice.
items.detail: We help you prepare questions but do not replace qualified specialists.
We invite reflection and experimentation; you hold the final say.
If mental health, safeguarding, or legal concerns arise we pause and point you to the right support.
We keep sessions private within the boundaries set by ICF ethics.

items.question: Can my partner join a session?
items.answer: Yes, for specific decision points. The focus stays on your goals, and we agree on boundaries before inviting others.

items.question: What if relocation plans change mid-way?
items.answer: We adapt. Sessions can pivot to staying put, renegotiating offers, or pausing until timing is right.

items.question: Do you work with employer-sponsored moves?
items.answer: Yes. We clarify confidentiality and reporting lines so you can think freely even if the company pays.

items.question: Is one session enough?
items.answer: You can book a single paid session, though most transition clients benefit from six to see experiments through.

cta.title: Ready to steady your transition?
cta.body: Book an intro session to explore whether this partnership fits your move.

seo.title: Early-career coaching for testing options | SustainSage
seo.description: Hold space to explore courses, internships, and first roles with grounded support that respects your pace.

hero.title: A grounded space for students and early-career professionals to test options.
hero.subtitle: Experiment with directions without pretending you have it all figured out.

who.title: Who this is for
who.description: Moments when early-career clients ask for a thinking partner.

items.summary: Final-year students unsure about the course they chose.
items.detail: You wonder if postgraduate study, switching programmes, or working first makes more sense.

items.summary: Graduates in their first or second role feeling stuck.
items.detail: You are learning the job yet unsure whether to stay, pivot internally, or look elsewhere.

items.summary: International students balancing visas and expectations.
items.detail: You juggle sponsor rules, family hopes, and your own sense of direction.

items.summary: Professionals exploring a second career before 35.
items.detail: You built skills in one area and want to test creative or impact-driven paths without burning bridges.

topics.title: Common topics we work on
topics.description: Practical questions that show up in early-career coaching.

items.summary: Regretting a course or major choice.
items.detail: We map transferable skills, debt or visa considerations, and realistic pivots.

items.summary: Internships that do not convert to offers.
items.detail: We build feedback loops, networking scripts, and clearer asks.

items.summary: Managers say you need to be “more proactive” but no one explains how.
items.detail: We translate vague feedback into doable actions and reflective questions.

items.summary: Deciding whether to stay in the UK or return home.
items.detail: We weigh immigration timelines, financial commitments, and what “home” means right now.

howWeWork.title: How we work together
howWeWork.description: Most clients choose a series of five 55-minute sessions across eight weeks, with optional add-ons for applications.

items.detail: We clarify what would make coaching worthwhile before you commit.
We gather context: finances, mental load, visa timelines, family voices, and curiosities.
We outline informational interviews, side projects, or low-risk trials with timeframes.
We interpret what you learned, adjust boundaries, and plan the next quarter.

howWeWork.note: We meet on Zoom. Light check-ins between sessions keep momentum without pressure.

expect.title: What may shift for you
expect.description: Clients describe feeling more resourced, not magically certain.

items.detail: You can explain priorities to yourself, family, and interviewers without apology.
Small experiments replace the pressure to decide perfectly.
You notice doubt without letting it freeze every choice.

items.summary: Awareness of when to seek other help.
items.detail: You can spot when mentorship, therapy, or training would serve you better.

boundaries.title: Boundaries & ethics
boundaries.description: We stay in the coaching lane while pointing to other resources when needed.

items.detail: We notice emotional patterns and will suggest mental health professionals if risk appears.
We help you strategise and practise; you own applications and results.
We will not push a timeline that ignores your obligations or energy.

faq.title: Questions people ask
faq.description: Answering what early-career clients tend to worry about.

items.question: What if I have no clear goal yet?
items.answer: That is common. We start by mapping what feels noisy, then identify experiments instead of forcing a big decision.

items.question: Can my parent or mentor join?
items.answer: We keep sessions one-to-one so you can speak freely. You can choose what to share with others afterwards.

items.question: English is not my strongest language—will this work?
items.answer: Yes. We can switch between English and Mandarin, slow down, or use written reflections when helpful.

items.question: Can we work session by session?
items.answer: You may, though momentum usually builds across at least four sessions. We agree a plan that fits your budget.

cta.title: Want to test your next move with support?
cta.body: Book an intro session so we can hear your context and see if this pathway fits.

seo.title: Coaching for working parents balancing care and careers | SustainSage
seo.description: Design sustainable rhythms for work, caregiving, and rest with an ICF-aligned coach who understands cross-border family life.

hero.title: Space for working parents to plan sustainable rhythms.
hero.subtitle: We hold room for both care and work so you can design weeks that respect capacity.

who.title: Who this is for
who.description: Situations where parents and caregivers seek a steadier rhythm.

items.summary: Returning from parental leave sooner than expected.
items.detail: You are asked to perform as if nothing changed, yet your body and routines feel different.

items.summary: Coordinating childcare with erratic shifts or study timetables.
items.detail: Nursery closures, sudden overtime, or exams keep derailing your plans.
Grandparents or carers are overseas, so you are rebuilding support almost from scratch.

items.summary: Managing elder care alongside young children.
items.detail: You are part of the sandwich generation and need a plan that will not burn everyone out.

topics.title: Common topics we work on
topics.description: Themes that show up repeatedly with working parents.

items.summary: Bedtime or nursery drop-offs clash with team meetings.
items.detail: We design scripts to renegotiate expectations without guilt.

items.summary: You feel guilty when work or care gets more attention.
items.detail: We explore values and boundaries so guilt becomes data rather than a verdict.

items.summary: Re-entering after a multi-year pause feels daunting.
items.detail: We rebuild confidence, name transferable skills, and pace applications.

items.summary: You want time for rest or exercise but the week is already full.
items.detail: We examine invisible labour and redistribute or remove tasks where possible.

howWeWork.title: How we work together
howWeWork.description: Typical package: six 55-minute sessions across twelve weeks, with optional partner check-ins when agreed.

items.detail: We clarify what support you need and any household considerations.
We map visible and invisible tasks, emotional labour, and support systems.
We design practical adjustments to schedules, delegation, and recovery.
We prepare conversations with partners, managers, or schools so changes stick.

items.summary: Session 6 · Review signals and next season.
items.detail: We consolidate what works, flag risks, and plan check-in rituals for the household.

howWeWork.note: Sessions take place on Zoom. We can schedule within school hours or evenings UK time.

expect.title: What may shift for you
expect.description: Parents describe feeling less alone and more intentional after this work.

items.detail: Calendars, budgets, and responsibilities live somewhere other than your head.
You know which requests to decline and how to explain the why.
Simple practices—short rests, exercise, help requests—that survive busy weeks.

items.summary: Confidence to ask for external support.
items.detail: You recognise when to involve HR policies, healthcare providers, or community networks.

boundaries.title: Boundaries & ethics
boundaries.description: We coach within the ICF framework and respect your family’s autonomy.

items.detail: We explore options but do not replace health visitors, therapists, or safeguarding professionals.
Partners can join when it serves you; we set agreements together first.
We keep discussions private except where safety laws require otherwise.

items.summary: We flag when other support is urgent.
items.detail: If burnout, depression, or violence risk appears we pause and help you access specialised services.

faq.title: Questions people ask
faq.description: Answers to concerns working parents mention most.

items.question: My schedule is chaotic—can coaching still work?
items.answer: Yes. We co-create flexible scheduling or asynchronous check-ins. If it is not the right season, we will say so honestly.

items.question: Can we include my partner or co-parent?
items.answer: We can invite them for specific sessions once boundaries are clear and consented to by everyone.

items.question: What if caring emergencies interrupt sessions?
items.answer: Life happens. We reschedule within the package and design backup plans to reduce stress next time.

items.question: Will you tell me how to parent?
items.answer: No. We focus on decision-making, boundaries, and support—not judging your parenting style.

cta.title: Ready to create a rhythm that holds you too?
cta.body: Book an intro session to see whether this coaching fits your family’s season.

seo.title: Leadership coaching for cross-cultural teams | SustainSage
seo.description: Partner with an ICF-aligned coach to navigate influence, delegation, and wellbeing across cultures without performing a role that is not yours.

hero.title: Reflective coaching for leaders who want clarity without theatre.
hero.subtitle: Think through cross-cultural leadership, influence, and boundaries with a grounded partner.

who.title: Who this is for
who.description: Leaders balancing complex expectations across cultures and teams.

items.summary: You lead a UK or Europe-based team from overseas.
items.detail: Time zones, accents, and hybrid norms make every conversation strategic.

items.summary: You recently stepped into a bigger remit.
items.detail: You are responsible for budgets, risk, and people dynamics with little onboarding.

items.summary: You hold tensions between senior stakeholders and your team.
items.detail: You want to advocate for your people without burning bridges upward.
You need a confidential space to test boundaries before health or relationships crack.

topics.title: Common topics we work on
topics.description: Situations leaders bring into the room.

items.summary: Board updates feel like performance art.
items.detail: We structure narratives that align with your values while meeting expectations.

items.summary: Delegation keeps bouncing back to you.
items.detail: We design handovers, feedback loops, and boundaries that stick.

items.summary: You need to challenge bias or unfair policy.
items.detail: We plan language that is direct, culturally aware, and still protects you.

items.summary: Your calendar leaves no space to think.
items.detail: We create reflective habits and rituals so you stay ahead instead of firefighting.

howWeWork.title: How we work together
howWeWork.description: Standard engagement: six 60-minute sessions across three months, extendable for longer-term partnerships.

items.detail: We clarify priorities, stakeholders, and confidentiality before starting.
We identify power lines, culture codes, and decision rhythms shaping your role.
We rehearse conversations, stress-test plans, and notice repeating patterns.
We track experiments around delegation, communication, and wellbeing.
We agree signals for when to revisit coaching or seek other support.

howWeWork.note: Optional between-session reviews via Loom or written notes help you integrate learning in real time.

expect.title: What may shift for you
expect.description: Leaders notice clearer thinking and grounded actions after working together.

items.detail: You communicate decisions with confidence and context.
You know who owns what, how to follow up, and when to step back.
You can say no to theatre and yes to what sustains impact.
You stop copying scripts that never suited you.

boundaries.title: Boundaries & ethics
boundaries.description: We respect organisational confidentiality while keeping coaching client-led.

items.detail: We do not label colleagues or make HR decisions for you.
We notice emotional strain and signpost specialist care when needed.
We define reporting boundaries so you know what stays confidential.
If we hear safeguarding or legal risk we will discuss next steps transparently.

faq.title: Questions people ask
faq.description: Concerns senior leaders often raise before starting.

items.question: Can my employer fund this?
items.answer: Often, yes. We agree tri-party boundaries in writing so you retain psychological safety.

items.question: Do you coach in both English and Mandarin?
items.answer: Yes. We can switch languages mid-session to capture nuance and design scripts in either language.

items.question: What if I need support between sessions?
items.answer: You can share urgent situations via secure notes. We will decide together whether to add a session or handle it asynchronously.

items.question: Will you tell me the “right” leadership style?
items.answer: No. We experiment until you land on an approach that is effective and authentic for you.

cta.title: Want a reflective partner for your leadership context?
cta.body: Book an intro session so we can understand your landscape and see whether the fit is right.
